publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1073 Mike Pringle: Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers-That the Parliament supports all troops serving in the Gulf; notes that many friends and family in Scotland have boosted the morale of the troops by sending parcels and letters, and calls on the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government to allow small packages and letters to be sent free through the British Forces Post Office to soldiers in the Gulf and not to levy charges on a vital service at this time of continued uncertainty in Iraq.

S2M-1073 Mike Pringle: Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers-That the Parliament supports all troops serving in the Gulf; notes that many friends and family in Scotland have boosted the morale of the troops by sending parcels and letters, and calls on the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government to allow small packages and letters to be sent free through the British Forces Post Office to soldiers in the Gulf and not to levy charges on a vital service at this time of continued uncertainty in Iraq. Supported by: Margo MacDonald*
S2M-1073 Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers (lodged on 18 March 2004) Tommy Sheridan*, Donald Gorrie*, Linda Fabiani*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Chris Ballance*, Kate Maclean*, Robin Harper*

S2M-1073 Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers (lodged on 18 March 2004) Murray Tosh*, Murdo Fraser*, Brian Adam*, Robert Brown*, Mr David Davidson*, Nora Radcliffe*, Helen Eadie*, Alex Neil*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Eleanor Scott*, George Lyon*, John Swinburne*
S2M-1073 Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers (lodged on 18 March 2004) Mrs Nanette Milne*, Richard Lochhead*
S2M-1073 Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers (lodged on 18 March 2004) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-1073 Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers (lodged on 18 March 2004) Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-1073 Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers (lodged on 18 March 2004) Phil Gallie*, John Scott*
S2M-1073 Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers (lodged on 18 March 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-1073 Free Postage to Gulf Soldiers (lodged on 18 March 2004) Dennis Canavan*
